results.title: Case study
results.creator_credit: Peggy Girshman, COMAP and Chedd-Angier Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 26 of Series “Against all odds: inside statistics”.
Hosted by Teresa Amabile, this program presents a detailed case study of statistics at work in a real world setting, demonstrating the range and power of concepts and techniques shown in the series. The case study follows the development and use of the drug AZT.
results.description:

results.title: Case studies in effective schooling
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Institute of Educational Administration
results.brief_description: A series of professional development programs using case studies from Victorian schools which focus on aspects of providing quality education in State Schools.

results.title: Case studies 1: projects mean people
results.brief_description: SUMMARY: Uses three case studies to show the reactions of people affected by the introduction of major computer systems. looks in turn at Koch Light Laboratories, the Kingston upon Hull County Borough Council’s vaccination and immunisation scheme and the

results.title: Case of the hidden factor
results.creator_credit: Stanley Dalby, Gil Brealey and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Discusses the scope for improvement of storage and handling methods in industry, showing examples of good and poor practice, and the work of the National Materials Handling Bureau in the field.
